title: Google App Engine
summary: Google App Engine (often referred to as GAE or simply App Engine) is a cloud computing platform as a service for developing and hosting web applications in Google-managed data centers. Applications are sandboxed and run across multiple servers.[2] App Engine offers automatic scaling for web applicationsâ€”as the number of requests increases for an application, App Engine automatically allocates more resources for the web application to handle the additional demand.[3]
